poem:
**The Study**

So much time—  
thumb on glass,  
the small bright river  
of faces and games.

Mothers fear it  
like damp in the walls.

But the figures,  
25,000 children  
moving year to year,  
say: no.

Anxiety isn't  
in the screen itself—  
it is elsewhere,  
already in the room.
